name: How To Spin WILDSPUN Yarn
description:
I taught my friend Rosie to spin. The next time I came to her art studio I saw her plying yarns unlike anyone else I'd ever seen. "You are a GENIUS!" I said. So this tutorial is dedicated to her and her boundless creativity and fearlessness in the fiber art world. She is a wonderful light to the fiber art community and has a studio called "Wild Woman Creations" in Depoe, Bay Oregon where you can hear the surf and seagulls.

This yarn BREAKS ALL THE RULES. Take any commercial yarns in your stash and we will be spinning them using Rosie's original "bicycle" technique, and my own "blind-folded" technique. If you are finding yourself creatively worn out, use this video as spinning therapy. Don't worry about yarns matching or looking perfect, just do it. Break some rules. Dare to make something ugly. Let your creativity flow. Next time you spin at your wheel you'll feel refreshed and excited from all the new ideas you have flowing thru the joy of imperfection.

Skill Level: Beginner/Intermediate

SUPPLIES:
- Any commercial yarns. I used four novelty yarns, and will show techniques for three and two novelty yarns. Use as many commercial yarns as you dare.

Dedicated to Rosie Wildwoman
https://www.facebook.com/Wildwomancreations
http://www.wildwomancreations.com/
http://wildwomancreations.etsy.com

name: How to Spin Swanky Singles
description:
Tired of the everyday single spun yarn?  In this tutorial we will be adding unique knots, braids, slubs, whatevers, and textures to a single yarn.  No Plying Allowed!!!  

This yarn is inspired by several techniques from Lexi Boeger's book Intertwined.  She teaches spinning techniques in workshops around the world (http://www.pluckyfluff.com).

Skill Level: Intermediate

SUPPLIES:
- Art Batt - 2+ ounces is great, for a more substantial yarn use 4+ ounces.
- Top or Roving - 1+ ounces is great, more if you'd like more braids in your yarn.
- Fiber add-ins  - however much you'd like to use.  Try locks too!
- Thread for wrapping - black sewing thread, neon thread, nylon shine thread, or metallic thread all work great.

Fiber for this yarn was provided by...
Art Batt - Atomic Blue Fiber http://atomicblue.etsy.com
Wool Top - Hogg Wild Fibers http://hoggwildfibers.etsy.com
Soffsilk - CAMAJ  http://camaj.etsy.com

name: How to Spin Roots Yarn
description:
In this 20 minute video tutorial we will cover how to spin this yarn including various options you can choose to add or not use when you spin your own skein.

This yarn is based on "Twists" from Lexi Boeger's book Intertwined.  Michelle Snowdon from Wooldancer (http://www.wooldancer.com) did the same technique and called it "Twists on Twists".  She teaches this technique in workshops in Australia.  I was honored to meet her on her US tour in 2013 and fell in love with this technique and am excited to share it with you.  

In this video you will learn how to create singles, doubles, triples, quads, and freeform root systems.  You will also watch me troubleshoot this yarn and how to prevent your twists from being too loosey-goosey.

This is a great alternative yarn to tailspun and would be perfect for my Buttercuffs Boot Toppers pattern.  It is a ready to wear fringey scarf, or you can use it to embellish a hat or a shawl 

Supplies:
- Any Fiber (roving, top, art batt)
- Any Plying Thread (you will see it so make sure it's a color that coordinates with your fiber)

Skill Level: Intermediate

Fiber for this yarn was dyed by...
Sarah Hollandsworth of Yarn Geek Fibers 
http://YarnGeekFibers.etsy.com

name: How to Spin Alphonse Mucha Yarn
description:
In this 35 minute tutorial we will cover how to spin this yarn including various options you can choose to add or not use when you spin your own skein.

Supplies:
- A 4 ounce art batt carded by Lisa Renee McKenzie of Oscar & Sophia on ETSY (feel free to substitute with any top, roving, or batt)
- 0.5 oz Soffsilk from CAMAJ on ETSY (or any accent fiber)
- Beads
- Plying Thread (I used cotton crochet thread)
- Wrapping Thread (I used metallic gold, you can use any fine thread like black sewing thread or neon sewing thread or nylon thread for shine)

This is one of the funniest videos I've ever made because this yarn looks NOTHING like I originally planned it.  As I encounter mistake after mistake, tangle after tangle, and problem after problem - you can see how I work thru these difficulties in spinning to create a beautiful yarn.  Laugh with me as my beads tangle, my yarn breaks, and the entire thing almost falls apart.  However, when the yarn is finally finished, it's a stable, secure, wearable work of art.  

After purchase, you will receive the directions with a link to an unlisted video on YouTube via email in PDF format.  Please let me know if you have any questions.  

Thank you for your purchase!

name: Buttercuffs Knitting Pattern
description:
Buttercuffs Knitting Pattern for Bulky Handspun Art Yarn for Beginners

A super easy pattern for beginners to knit boot cuffs from about 30 yards of chunky single-ply handspun yarn and about 35 yards of super thick and thin art yarn. I used size 15 and size 10.5 double pointed knitting needles. These cuffs are a great for showcasing thick and thin textures in art yarn. The loops are created with the extra thick sections of the yarn, allowing them to hang free from the knit to maintain gauge. You can create loops with any balanced thick and thin art yarn.

You can use the dimensions of this pattern to work with any art yarn as long as you know about how many stitches per inch you need (add more yardage as necessary). You can also use this pattern to make longer or shorter cuffs just by knitting until you reach the length you need.

Handspun Yarn by Robyn Story of Yarns and Storys:
http://yarnsandstorys.etsy.com

Handspun Yarn by Heather Lightbody of Girl with a Hook:
http://girlwithahook.etsy.com

After you purchase this listing I will email you the pattern in a PDF.  Thank you!

name: How to Spin Sculptural Art Yarns
description:
How to Spin Sculptural Art Yarns
Intermediate Video Collection 
(3 videos / 25 minutes)

After you purchase this listing you can download a document with a link to a 25 minute video about how to spin sculptural / unbreakable art yarns. This document will also tell you the supplies you need to create all the yarns in this video series. Following is a description of what you will learn how to spin in these videos. This series is for intermediate/advanced spinners. You will need a basic understanding of core-spinning.

1. UNBREAKABLE: Using an unbreakable core, we will core-spin and troubleshoot how to create super bulky yarns that are perfect for projects you need to put under a lot of tension (great for weaving!) or projects you plan on sculpting with freeform crochet or knitting. We will discuss troubleshooting and project ideas as well.

2. UNBREAKABLE II & WIRE: In the second video of this collection we will learn how to core-spin thick and bulky yarns on a different unbreakable core that is more drapey than the first tutorial. We will also be experimenting with wire. This technique I use for spinning wire is different than in my book, and much easier for me personally work with. We will troubleshoot the difficulties that come with spinning wire and discuss project ideas.

3. STRETCHY: In the third and final video we will talk about spinning on stretchy cores and you will learn how to keep your stretchy yarn from unraveling from its core. We will talk about mixed media additions you can include in this yarn as well as troubleshooting and the best elastic cores to use.

Thanks to the following fiber artisans for supplying the art batts for this video tutorial.

Sayra Adams of Atomic Blue Fibers
http://atomicblue.etsy.com

Kimberly Buchy of Woodland Hills Alpacas
http://WoodlandHillsAlpacas.etsy.com

name: Josephine Cowl Knitting Pattern
description:
A super easy pattern for beginners to knit this extra bulky chunky cowl from two handspun yarns. For this cowl pair I used about 60 yards of chunky worsted 2-ply handspun yarn and 15-20 yards of super bulky art yarn. I used size 15 knitting needles. This cowl is very drapey and sculptural. The dropped stitches of the yarn create a loopy fringe. You can use the dimensions of this pattern to work with any art yarn as long as you know about how many stitches per inch you need.

Handspun 2-Ply Yarn by Sayra Adams of Atomic Blue:
http://atomicblue.etsy.com

Super Bulky Art Yarn by Amber Churchill of Designs by Amber
http://designsbyamber.etsy.com

name: Soho Mitts Knitting Pattern
description:
A super easy pattern for beginners to knit extra bulky mitts from about 30-35 yards of handspun yarn. I used size 15 double pointed knitting needles. These mitts are a great for bulky core-spun yarn. The dropped stitch row can be worn along the top or underside of the mitts. You can use the dimensions of this pattern to work with any art yarn as long as you know about how many stitches per inch you need (and add more yardage as necessary). You can also use this pattern to make longer or shorter mitts just by continuing the pattern until you reach the length you need.

Handspun Yarn by Leslie of Spinning Spinderella:
http://spinningspinderella.etsy.com

name: Art Yarn Video Set of 5 Techniques
description:
After you purchase this listing you can download a document with links to all 5 original art yarn spinning tutorials. Following is a description of all the yarns you will learn how to spin in these videos. To purchase individual videos, please visit my shop.

1. UPCYCLED YARN: Transform the boring commercial yarns in your stash into new & modern upcycled handspun art yarns! You can also use recycled yarns from unraveled sweaters in this technique. Using a combination of yarns and techniques - you can transform your boring collection of commercial yarn into a brand new handspun stash!!

2. AIRSPUN YARN: Learn how to spin super fluffy puffy light and airy "airspun" yarn! Learn the traditional mohair airspun method, as well as a modern method using other fine luxury fibers in your stash! Bonus techniques at the end include adding a curly tendril of yarn and a fancy plying technique! The finished yarn is a brand new combination-technique of my own design, which you can play with to your heart's content. 4 techniques in one video!! Use one or all techniques, with locks and other fibers, to create your own individual art yarns.

3. RECYCLED YARN: After unraveling a cashmere or other luxury fiber sweater, you can spin that yarn as-is into a new texture-full recycled yarn technique! Great for spinners on a budget who want to play with luxury fibers at a fraction of the cost. To learn how to unravel a sweater please read my tutorial at www.recycleyarn.com or watch the FREE tutorial on YouTube. This yarn can be made from ANY recycled sweater yarn! A great way to recycle your old sweaters into fun and modern handspun art.

4. LOCKSPUN YARN: Learn how to spin curly swirly texture-full lockspun art yarn! Combining two fancy techniques into one gorgeous yarn. This yarn technique is perfect if you want your yarn to look exactly like a pile of locks when it's done being spun. Also included is a brand new combination-technique as well. Two techniques in one video! Use one or both techniques, with locks and other fibers, to create your own individual art yarns.

5. SHELLSPUN YARN: Learn how to spin lumpy bumpy "seashells" into your art yarn with 5 different plying techniques! Use one, two, or a combination of all 5 techniques to create your own shellspun art yarns. Each technique is an art yarn by itself! Included are plenty of tips and hints on different ways to change the entire look of each yarn you spin. Using these hints & techniques - you will get a completely different looking yarn every time.

name: McKenzie Cowl Knitting Pattern
description:
A super easy pattern for beginners to knit this extra bulky art yarn cowl. This is a beautiful pattern for an organic, freeform style cowl to show off a uniquely textures art yarn. For this cowl I used about 30-40 yards of corespun bulky art yarn and some recycled sari silk ribbon. I used a size 15 16-inch circular knitting needle.

Corespun Bulky Art Yarn by Lisa Renee McKenzie of Oscar & Sophia:
http://oscarandsophia.etsy.com

name: Muk Luckys Legwarmers Pattern
description:
A super easy pattern for beginners to knit this extra bulky chunky pair of legwarmers. For this pair I used about 75 yards of corespun bulky art yarn and 8 yards of tailspun yarn. I used a size 15 16-inch circular knitting needle. These are super cozy and warm. You can wear the cuffs up or down. You can use the dimensions of this pattern to work with any art yarn as long as you know about how many stitches per inch you need.

>>>> After you purchase this item I will email the pattern to you as a PDF.  

Corespun Bulky Art Yarn by Lisa Renee McKenzie of Oscar & Sophia:
http://oscarandsophia.etsy.com

Tailspun Art Yarn by Esther Rogers of JazzTurtle
http://jazzturtle.etsy.com

name: Spinning and Dyeing Yarn: The Home Spinners Guide to Creating Traditional and Art Yarns [Hardcover]
description: I am no longer selling books from my shop, but you can purchase them on Amazon! Click Here to Purchase the Book on Amazon! If you would like your copy to be autographed, please email me at neauveau@gmail.com for my address. If you pay shipping to/from me I will happily sign your book and include a yarn bookmark in it.

name: Graphic Design: Complete Package
description:
A complete online overhaul that will result in a professional branded look for your blog, Facebook business page, ETSY shop, business cards, post cards, logos, and graphics.  

You Will Receive
- A remodeled blog (using the blogger platform) that you can update easily.  Blog includes links & pages.  This will be linked to a domain name (www.yourwebsite.com) and will become your website.
- Graphics for your blog
- Graphics for all your blog pages.
- Graphics for business cards and postcards thru VistaPrint.
- Graphics for your ETSY shop
- Graphics for your Ravelry page
- Graphics for your Facebook page
- Technical Support for one month.  I only take on one of these projects a month, and make sure you have everything you need and everything is updated and running smoothly.  After 30 days additional graphics, ads, banners, etc. will an additional cost.

All of the graphics I create are from your photos.  It's important to have a somewhat large collection of ready-to-use photos for me to pull from and create graphics for you.  I recommend uploading your photos into a Flickr album for me to download and edit into your graphics.  Remember to include photos in all the categories that you blog about: gardening, knitting, spinning, weaving, fiber, sheep, animals, family, etc.  A minimum of 50 photos is required, and I may ask for more as we progress.  Feel free to upload 100+ photos if you have them.  The more I have to work with, the faster your blog overhaul will be completed.

Overview:
- Create a blog thru blogger.com that I will use as the foundation for your website & blog.  Blogger is free.
- Choose a domain name (www.yourwebsite.com) that we can use to forward/mask your blog address.  Your blog and your website will be the same.  You will be responsible for purchasing and paying for this domain name.  Price range is about $10-12 per year.  
- I will take care of the layout, pages, and graphics.  You will only need to post new blogs (I recommend blogging at least once a week) to keep your blog updated and looking fresh.

Below are some of the features of most blogs.  All of these are options and you can either choose to include them or not.

- Social Networking (option): Links will be created for all the networking sites you are on (ex: Twitter, Flickr, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest).  Before starting the remodel I will need to know what social networking websites you are on and what those links are (example: http://www.facebook.com/yourname/)

- Galleries (option): will be created using Flickr slideshows.  That way when you have more items to add to a gallery, just upload them into the correct Flickr album and they will automatically show up on your website.  Before the blog remodel, if you want galleries, please create sets on your Flickr account and upload the photos you want into each gallery.  Then give me a link to those galleries and I will create a graphic for each one and embed the slideshow into your blog seamlessly.  

- Online Shop (option): will be embedded into your website.  That way when you add an item to your show, it will show up automatically on your website.

- Tutorials (option): Depends on if the tutorials are written, videos, links.  But this can be it's own page linking to all your blog posts about Tutorials, or featuring groups of tutorials on a page (ex: knitting videos) or linking to your YouTube account.

- Press (option): Will showcase where you have been linked/published 

- About Me (option): Before the blog remodel, please write up the text that you'd want in your biography if you choose to have this page on your blog.

- Contact (option): This can be a direct link to your email address or a page with your Name, address, email, etc. 

If this sounds like what you need to get your website off the ground, please send me an email to neauveau@gmail.com.  Each blog redesign takes 1-2 weeks to complete.  Payment will be agreed upon before the beginning of the remodel, and is 100% due up front.  

RECOMMENDED READING

Please read the link on blog design and complete the printable below and email to me before we get started.  This will help me understand what your style & goals are for your blog.  

READ: http://www.theflourishingabode.com/2012/07/diy-blog-design.html

DOWNLOAD & COMPLETE: http://www.theflourishingabode.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/Blog-Branding-101-The-Flourishing-Abode.pdf

name: Graphic Design: ETSY & Social Media Package
description:
Included in this graphics package is:

1. Square icon for your Facebook business page, ETSY shop, and Ravelry Page
2. 851x315 Facebook Header for your business page
3. A 760x100 ETSY Banner for your shop
4. A 100x60 Ravelry Badge for your ravelry page 
5. A 468x60 Ravelry Banner for your ravelry page

I will email you the completed graphics package for you to upload onto your page/shop.  The fonts I use are open-source so you won't need to worry about copyright laws, and the images I use will come from your photos.  

You can choose to send me high res photos to use for your banner/graphics OR you can let me choose from your Facebook or Flickr albums.

Turn-around time for the graphics package is within 1 week (because I have a baby).  I will contact you if there is a delay (I am out of town, away from a computer, baby is sick, etc.)

name: 8 ounce bag of mixed fiber
description:
You will receive a completely random 8 ounce bag of mixed wools and fibers.  Each bag is unique and a mixture of ABOUT 50% un-dyed and 50% dyed fiber.  

Here is an example of fibers I have found while stuffing the bags:

Lincoln Longwool
Baby Wensleydale Locks
Border Leicester Locks
Mohair
Angelina
Firestar
Alpaca
Llama
Romney x Merino Wool
Merino
Navajo Churro
Mixed Primitive Wools
Mixed Medium Wools
Mystery Crimpy Farm Wools
Raw Cashmere
Carded Bits o' Batts
Dyed Wool Top
Dyed Curly Locks
Faux Cashmere
Cotton
Recycled Cashmere Yarn (black, white, pistachio)
Wool/Silk Blend Top
Ribbons and Threads

Each bag will contain a random assortment of some of the fibers above (not every fiber above).  You can card these bags of fiber into art batts, or spin them as-is, or felt them.  The possibilities are endless!!!

name: 4 oz Wool Thread Scrap
description:
Up for grabs are several pounds of wool thread scrap from the Pendleton Mill in Oregon.  Colors may vary, but most of the scrap is similar to this photo.  Pendleton no longer sells thread scrap, so this unique batt embellishment is very rare!

These threads are great for carding into art batts.  Cut them into 3-4 inch lengths and throw them in your drum carder!  

Selling in 4 oz lots.

name: Spinning Art Yarn Without a Drum Carder
description:
Spin-Spiration Techniques II: Cardables / Spinning Art Yarn Without a Drum Carder

In this video I take one 8oz bag of cardables from my shop (you can use any random fibers and locks from your stash) and transform it into a unique art yarn without using a drum carder or fiber processing equipment of any kind.

This is a great video for those of you who don't have a drum carder or a wool picker to process fibers.  I'll show you how to spin this yarn simply by using your hands!

I use a cone of cotton/nylon blend thread for some of the techniques in this tutorial.  

Keep in mind this tutorial does not cover plying.  The possibilities are endless when you combine the techniques in this tutorial with the plying techniques in my SHELLSPUN video tutorial!

name: Spinning Fabric and Novelty Threads
description:
This video will cover multiple ways of spinning using the following materials:

- An Art Batt (3+ ounces will do)
- Commercial thread for auto wrapping and core spinning
- Vintage cotton Fabric (you can also use lace or silk ribbon)
- Pom Pom yarn (from a craft store).  You can also use eyelash yarn or any novelty/commercial yarn to add texture/embellishment.

Some of the techniques covered in this video are:
- Autowrapping variations
- Corespinning variations
- Wrapping clumps of fiber into yarn
- Wrapping clumps of fabric into yarn
- Spinning fabric variations
- Using fabric as a core
- Self-striping fabric and fiber
- Including novelty yarns and threads

This video is 27 minutes long and covers the entire process of spinning the yarn.  

You will need to have a basic understanding of spinning a single and corespinning.

name: How to Spin Lockspun Art Yarn on a Spinning Wheel
description:
Learn how to spin curly swirly texture-full lockspun art yarn!  Combining two fancy techniques into one gorgeous yarn.  This yarn technique is perfect if you want your yarn to look exactly like a pile of locks when it's done being spun.   Also included is a brand new combination-technique as well.  Two techniques in one video!  Use one or both techniques, with locks and other fibers, to create your own individual art yarns.  

After you purchase this video, I will email you a link to the video and you can watch it as many times as you want, from any computer.  Please do not share or copy the link to others.  Thank you!

name: How to Spin Airspun Art Yarn on a Spinning Wheel
description:
Learn how to spin super fluffy puffy light and airy "airspun" yarn!  Learn the traditional mohair airspun method, as well as a modern method using other fine luxury fibers in your stash!  Bonus techniques at the end include adding a curly tendril of yarn and a fancy plying technique!  The finished yarn is a brand new combination-technique of my own design, which you can play with to your heart's content.  4 techniques in one video!!  Use one or all techniques, with locks and other fibers, to create your own individual art yarns.  

After you purchase this technique, I will email you a link to the video and you can watch it as many times as you want, from any computer.  Please be kind and do not share the link with others.  Thank you!

name: How to Spin Upcycled Yarn on a Spinning Wheel
description:
Transform the boring commercial yarns in your stash into new & modern upcycled handspun art yarns!  You can also use recycled yarns from unraveled sweaters in this technique.  Using a combination of yarns and techniques - you can transform your boring collection of commercial yarn into a brand new handspun stash!!  

After you purchase this listing, I will email you a link to the video which has been uploaded to YouTube.  It is a private video and only people who purchase this listing will have the link.  Please be kind and do not share the link with your friends.

name: How to Spin Shellspun Art Yarn on a Spinning Wheel
description:
Learn how to spin lumpy bumpy "seashells" into your art yarn with 5 different plying techniques!  Use one, two, or a combination of all 5 techniques to create your own shellspun art yarns.  Each technique is an art yarn by itself! Included are plenty of tips and hints on different ways to change the entire look of each yarn you spin.  Using these hints & techniques - you will get a completely different looking yarn every time.  

After purchasing I will email you a link to the video and you can watch it as many times as you want, from any computer.  Please do not share or copy the link.  Thank you!

name: How to Spin Recycled Art Yarn on a Spinning Wheel
description:
After unraveling a cashmere or other luxury fiber sweater, you can spin that yarn as-is into a new texture-full recycled yarn technique!  Great for spinners on a budget who want to play with luxury fibers at a fraction of the cost.  To learn how to unravel a sweater please read my tutorial at www.recycleyarn.com or watch the FREE tutorial on YouTube.  This yarn can be made from ANY recycled sweater yarn!  A great way to recycle your old sweaters into fun and modern handspun art.  

After you purchase this video, I will email you a link to the video and you can watch it as many times as you want, from any computer.  Please do not share or copy the link.  Thank you!
